channel.title: Arch Drops i686
channel.description:
1st the catalyst driver [url=http://www.archlinux.org/news/440/]and now i686.[/url]
I really don't care but I think there are going to be some people who aren't happy with this news..
Arch64 or no Arch :cool:
Edit: Anyway i686 users can still use the abs to build packages like the article says.
[size=1pt]Happy April 1[/size]

item.title: Arch Drops i686
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:10, topic:270617”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=357111.msg2731539#msg2731539 date=1238764041]

its a step in the right direction…

all new processors now have 64bit technology, we need to start using it.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 01-04-2009, 16:20:19[/size][hr]oh im dumb

aah ollie we all been there
[/quote]

unfortunately for you, you are still there.[/quote]
im still in April fool’s day am i? good one

Read full topic

item.title: Arch Drops i686
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Even x86 has some bugs and glitches, that seems like a big exaggeration.

Read full topic

item.title: Arch Drops i686
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

I wish this wasn’t a joke, I wouldn’t mind if they dropped i686! The x86_64 is running extremely fast with no bugs or glitches at all.

Read full topic

[/quote]

unfortunately for you, you are still there.

Read full topic

item.title: Arch Drops i686
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Archlinux.org”]i686 support not being dropped

Hi, Arch Linux users, we are pleased to inform you that the i686 architecture is not going to be dropped from Arch Linux. It all was part of an April Fools joke, in which all the developers and the forum moderators played a big part.

Interestingly, this joke actually did some good. Some of our users discovered that they were, in fact, running 64-bit processors, and many of them switched to the Arch Linux 64-bit version. We encourage anyone who already switched to keep using the 64-bit version, to continue contributing to the architecture and encourage support from other major software vendors.

A prime example of a vendor giving in to the demands of the 64-bit community is Adobe. They’ve recently added 64-bit Linux support to the flash plug-in, for which we thank them.

Sorry for any inconvenience this joke may have caused, but how can we resist a prank on the 1st of April?[/quote]

I fell for that one.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Kinda figured that out right away when the words “April Fools” were replaced by “awesome idea” on the ArchLinux Forums. And joke was replaced with “good idea”

That was brilliant on their part.
